reg.title: Naturopathic Physicians Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 227/2006, July 21, 2006]

definition.def: means the art of healing by natural methods or therapeutics, including the first aid treatment of minor cuts, abrasions and contusions, bandaging, taking of blood samples, and the prescribing or administering of authorized preparations and medicines.

subsection.subsectiontext: Naturopathic medicine is designated as a health profession.
The "College of Naturopathic Physicians of British Columbia" is the name of the college established under section 15 (1) of the Act for naturopathic medicine.
No person other than a registrant may use the title "naturopath", "naturopathic physician", "drugless physician", "sanipractic physician" or "drugless healer".
A registrant may use the title "doctor" or the abbreviation "Dr." but only as "Doctor of Naturopathic Medicine", "Dr. of Naturopathic Medicine", "Naturopathic Doctor" or "Naturopathic Dr.".

A naturopathic physician must not use the titles "doctor" or "physician" in such a way as to suggest an occupation relating to the treatment of human ailments, other than as permitted under this regulation.

section.sectiontext: A registrant may practise naturopathic medicine.
Subject to section 14 of the Act, no person other than a registrant may practise naturopathic medicine.
